result.execSummary:
The defendant Tomas Barajas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
IMPOSED AND STAYED. Consec to any sentence. Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: any sentence
Def may terminate after 2 yrs if all conditions are met including all financial obligations and no new referrals.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with AMR or CLR. Ban from 2400 blk of Sherman Ave, Madison, WI. Not use/possess alcohol.

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  DNA on file. Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tomas Barajas

Reporter:  Paige Reardon
Sentencing Excerpt, September 16, 2022
Copy send to DCJ
of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Copy of minutes from PLEAS Hrg on 9/16/22 sent electronically to DCJ.

1:58 PM Defendant Tomas Barajas in court, in custody.  Attorney Laura Breun in court for Tomas Barajas.  Prosecuting attorney Tracy L McMiller in court for the State of Wisconsin. Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

AMENDMENTS: 

Victim Rights Compliance

IMPOSED AND STAYED

COUNT #     1 
-serve 2 years in WSP, bifurcated into:
-initial confinement: 1 year
-extended supervision: 1 year
-cs to: any sentence

Challenge Incarceration Program: Not Eligible
Substance Abuse Program: Eligible

Stayed for 3 years probation

CONDITIONS:

-No contact with: AMR, CLR
-Ban: 2400 blk of Sherman Ave, Madison, WI
-Not use/possess alcohol
-Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals 
-DNA on file
-Undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
-Defn may terminate after 2 years if all conditions are met, including all financial obligations and no new referrals
-Restitution: State has 14 days to file
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct #1
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due on probation

-Days credit if revoked: 0

DE advised of post-conviction rights

Orally on record

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
Branch 12

10:30 AM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Laura Breun.  Timothy Robert Verhoff appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Madison Police Officer E. M., duly sworn and testified. Direct Exam by ADA Verhoff. Venue established. Witness identification. Cross Exam by Atty Breun. Witness excused. Madison Police Detective M. G., duly sworn and testified. Direct Exam by ADA Verhoff. Cross Exam by Atty Breun. State moves for bind over, waived argument, reserve rebuttal. Defn objected to bind over. Argument by Atty Breun. CT found PC this defn committed a felony and bound over to branch 12.
Atty Breun
Preliminary hearing on June 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with AMF or CLR. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 2400 block of Sherman Ave in Madison. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 12

02:33 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Jacob A Idlas.  Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
